publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5160 Chris Ballance: Shipping of Prawns—That the Parliament condemns the decision of Young’s Seafood Limited to ship prawns from the Solway up to 12,000 miles and back in order to be hand-shelled in Thailand and then returned to Scotland, without regard to the environmental damage caused by this unnecessary transportation and the loss of over a hundred Scottish jobs, and calls on the Scottish Executive to hold urgent talks with the company to discuss ways of reversing the decision. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-5160 Chris Ballance: Shipping of Prawns—That the Parliament condemns the decision of Young’s Seafood Limited to ship prawns from the Solway up to 12,000 miles and back in order to be hand-shelled in Thailand and then returned to Scotland, without regard to the environmental damage caused by this unnecessary transportation and the loss of over a hundred Scottish jobs, and calls on the Scottish Executive to hold urgent talks with the company to discuss ways of reversing the decision. Supported by: Alex Fergusson*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Patrick Harvie*, Nora Radcliffe*, Robin Harper*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Shiona Baird*, Tommy Sheridan*, Richard Lochhead*, Eleanor Scott*, Mike Pringle*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Murray Tosh*, Rob Gibson*, Mark Ballard*, Campbell Martin*
S2M-5160 Shipping of Prawns (lodged on 15 November 2006) John Swinburne*, Donald Gorrie*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-5160 Shipping of Prawns (lodged on 15 November 2006) Rosie Kane*
S2M-5160 Shipping of Prawns (lodged on 15 November 2006) Linda Fabiani*
